chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac James Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Carrying License. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Isaac James Martinez
Current: 1128 E Blackridge Dr Unit 101, Tucson, AZ 85719 United States  (Effective: 08-16-2016)
Prior: 348 E Mount Morris Ave, Wautoma, WI 54982

Pre-trial conference at 09-02-2015 03:00 pm.
Status conference at 09-15-2015 10:15 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Isaac James Martinez in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant regarding status. Defendant states he has an occupational and has the IID installed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 10:15 am.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.  No operation of any vehicles that are not equipped with an ignition interlock device.

Case called @ 1:30 p.m. Defendant Isaac James Martinez in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. DA Blader requesting $500 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $500 Sig Bond. NGP entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 09:20 am.
